Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class Player

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.GameObject
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Player
public class Player extends GameObject
The main character controlled by the user. Handles movement, collisions, lives, and power-up effects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Creates a new player at the specified position. Initializes all systems to their default states. The player starts facing south with full health and stamina.
      Parameters:
      x - starting x position in world coordinates
      y - starting y position in world coordinates
      width - width of the player sprite (16 pixels)
      height - height of the player sprite (16 pixels)

  • Method Details

    • keyDown

      public void keyDown(int keycode, GamePreferences prefs)
      Called when a key is pressed. Adds the key to a stack to handle smooth movement changes.

    • keyUp

      public void keyUp(int keycode, GamePreferences prefs)
      Called when a key is released. Removes the key from the input stack, allowing the previous direction to resume. Also handles sprint key release to stop sprinting.
      Parameters:
      keycode - the LibGDX keycode that was released
      prefs - user preferences for key bindings

    • clearInput

      public void clearInput()
      Resets all input and temporary status effects. Called when restarting a level, pausing, or entering a new area. Ensures the player doesn't start with lingering effects or stuck inputs.

    • update

      public void update(float delta, MapManager mapManager, GamePreferences prefs, MazeRunnerGame game)
      Updates the player logic every frame.(60 times per second [60 FPS])
      Parameters:
      delta - Time passed since last frame (in seconds).
      mapManager - Reference to the map for collision checking.
      prefs - User key bindings.

    • attemptAttack

      public void attemptAttack()
      Initiates a melee attack if cooldown has expired. Creates a temporary hitbox in front of the player for 0.2 seconds.

      Cannot attack if rooted (vine trap).

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int amount)
      Called when the player hits a trap or enemy. Handles removing lives and invincibility checks.
      Parameters:
      amount - The damage to take.

    • getAttackHitbox

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle getAttackHitbox()
      Generates a temporary Rectangle representing the sword's reach. Uses the current 'facing' direction to project a hitbox in front of the player. And from that hitbox we calculate If we hit an enemy or not
      Returns:
      A Rectangle for collision detection, or null if not attacking.

    • applySlow

      public void applySlow(float duration)
      Applies slowness debuff to the player (reduces speed to 40%). Used by slowness traps and certain enemies. Grants 0.5s invincibility when effect expires.
      Parameters:
      duration - how long the slow lasts in seconds

    • applyRoot

      public void applyRoot(float duration)
      Applies root debuff to the player (completely prevents movement). Used by vine traps that immobilize the player. Grants 1.0s invincibility when effect expires (escape window).
      Parameters:
      duration - how long the root lasts in seconds

    • addLives

      public void addLives(int amount)
      Adds lives to the player (healing). Called by heart collectibles and mastery health regeneration. Maximum health is capped at 20.
      Parameters:
      amount - number of lives to add (usually 1)

      public int getLives()

    • getWeaponDamage

      public int getWeaponDamage()
      Gets the player's current weapon damage including all modifiers That is when the player has the 2X Damage powerup
      Returns:
      total damage dealt by the player's attack

    • activateDamageBoost

      public void activateDamageBoost(float duration)

    • isDamageBoostActive

      public boolean isDamageBoostActive()

    • isDashing

      public boolean isDashing()

    • setWeaponDamage

      public void setWeaponDamage(int newDamage)
      Updates the player's base weapon damage. Called when picking up weapon collectibles (stone sword, diamond sword, etc.) Mastery upgrades are added on top of this base value.
      Parameters:
      newDamage - the new base damage value (1-3)

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Custom draw method with visual feedback for status effects. Changes the player's tint color based on current state:
      Overrides:
      draw in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      batch - the SpriteBatch to draw with

    • isDeathAnimationFinished

      public boolean isDeathAnimationFinished()
      Checks if the death animation has finished playing. Used by GameScreen to trigger game over screen after animation completes. Death animation lasts 1 second before game over.
      Returns:
      true if player is dead and animation has finished

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(float x, float y)
      Description copied from class: GameObject
      Updates the object's position and moves the collision rectangle to match. Important: This keeps the visual position and the hitbox in sync. If you only update x and y without calling this, collisions won't work correctly.
      Overrides:
      setPosition in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      x - new x coordinate
      y - new y coordinate
